alert.note: Alert for Haleakala Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued March 06 at 3:39PM HST until March 10 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST TUESDAY FOR THE SUMMITS OF THE BIG ISLAND... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE SUMMITS OF THE BIG ISLAND AND HALEAKALA... .A broad upper level trough will move over the state and will bring a prolonged period of very strong winds for the summits of the Big Island and the summit of Haleakala this week. Winds could stay very strong through the weekend. ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 65 mph with localized gusts over 80 mph possible. * WHERE...Haleakala Summit. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong could make driving and walking dangerous. The winds could forcefully open doors and damage hinges or slam doors shut, possibly causing injuries.
info.instruction: A High Wind Watch for the summits means that strong and potentially damaging winds in excess of 56 mph with frequent gusts over 66 mph are expected but not yet occurring. Be prepared for road-closures. Postpone travel to the summits until conditions improve.
